IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Promotion of Peace and Social Justice. Peace Development Fund is a public Foundation that partners with community based organizations and social justice movements to provide grants, training and educational resources, working with donors and grantees to build a peaceful world.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Promotion of Peace and Social Justice. Peace Development Fund is a public Foundation that partners with community based organizations and social justice movements to provide grants, training and educational resources, working with donors and grantees to build a peaceful world.
IRS990.Desc: Through PDFs Community Organizing Grants Programs, we make grants to US community-based organizations working on issues of social justice, including environmental justice, economic justice, peace, human health & welfare, often in areas of the country where there are few grantmaking resources such as Iowa, South Dakota, Louisiana or the Southwest. PDFs Community Advised, Designated Grants and Donor Advised Funds bring donors, grassroots organizers and funders together for grantmaking and community building, strengthening relationships across sectors of the social justice movements. PDF Fiscal Sponsorship extends our mission and program; we sponsor on average 47 groups each year. With offices in California and Massachusetts, we offer all our programs to groups across the US, and fiscal sponsorship to those based in the US supporting international programs. 135 total grants were made.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: Black Indigenous and People of Co

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Officer directors etc family relationship Part VI line 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A Board Members spouse is the President of the Organization

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990 governing body review Part VI line 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Review process of 990 prepared by an independent CPA, reviewed by staff before submitted to board for review. Final review done by board of directors with employees.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Conflict of interest policy compliance Part VI line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Each board member is required to disclose potential conflicts annually and on going basis.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: CEO executive director top management comp Part VI line 15a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Salary structure reviewed by the board based on an annual performance review and benchmarks of other similar organizations and in compliance with current operating budget.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Other officer or key employee compensation Part VI line 15b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Executive Director reviews the work plan of other employees and submits recommendations to the Board for approval. The process is driven by the budget approved by the board.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Governing documents etc available to public Part VI line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Financial Statements and Governing documents are available on our website and upon a written request and reviewed on a case by case basis.
